title: Biden, Trump Barnstorm in Campaign's Last Weekend
summary: Both candidates targeting states that proved decisive in the 2016 election. WASHINGTON-President Trump and Democratic challenger Joe Biden barnstormed the Great Lakes states in the final days of the presidential election, with both candidates keenly aware that the region could once again hold the key to victory.

title: Remembering Sean Connery: Iconic James Bond and Actor's Actor
summary: While Sean Connery, who just died, is best known for his performances in films like the Bond franchise, 'The Hunt for Red October' and 'The Untouchables,' some of the Scottish actor's best roles are his least known.. One of the rituals of James Bond films has always been the presentation of the weapons-all those intricately lethal gizmos and multitasking vehicles for James to use on his far-flung missions in the course of finding the villain, seducing the woman and saving the world. But the most potent weapon of the franchise, as it found its style, seduced a vast audience and took over the movie world, was Sean Connery, the singular Scotsman who first played Bond in "Dr. No" almost 60 years ago, who defined him unto the ages and who died at age 90 in Nassau, Bahamas.

title: America Is Turning to Videogames Like Never Before
summary: With little else to do, Americans are spending record amounts of money on videogames. New players are taking up the habit, and even parents are embracing the pastime as a way for kids to socialize online. The way we entertain ourselves may never be the same.. Videogames were already a multibillion-dollar industry. The pandemic is sending them to another level.

title: GOP Chairwoman Pushes Party to Pursue Suburban Women Like Her
summary: Ronna McDaniel has used her influence with Trump to push for a big investment in TV ads with a softer tone. WASHINGTON-President Trump's deficit with suburban women has widened to the point that it poses a serious threat to his re-election, polls show. But he still maintains the support of one of them who, like the president, has a lot riding on Election Day.

title: The College Courses Entrepreneurs Wish They Had Taken
summary: Founders often find themselves without crucial skills. These classes would have been a big help.. It takes a diverse set of skills to be an entrepreneur. And a lot of founders wish they had learned those skills in school-instead of on the job.

title: England Set for Limited Lockdown to Slow Coronavirus
summary: Starting Nov. 5, bars, restaurants and nonessential stores must close, and people must stay at home, with limited exceptions for work, education and exercise. LONDON-British Prime Minister Boris Johnson announced a nationwide lockdown in England, the latest move in a widening European effort to contain the coronavirus's resurgence. From Thursday, bars, restaurants and nonessential stores must close, and people must stay at home, with limited exceptions for work, education and exercise, Mr. Johnson said at a news conference. Schools will remain open.

title: How Two Restaurants Have Survived Covid-19. So Far.

title: The 2020 New York City Marathon Goes Virtual
summary: Race organizers from New York Road Runners opted to call off the in-person race, but the virtual format allows runners to design their own route and race day conditions. On the first Sunday in November, thousands of people usually gather at the entrance to the Verrazzano-Narrows Bridge on Staten Island itching to run the first miles of the New York City Marathon. This year, with coronavirus rendering large-scale road races verboten, the iconic race is taking place on sun-drenched streets in San Diego, sprawling cornfields in Central Illinois and thousands of other locales across the world.

title: From Stevie Wonder to Stevie Nicks, the Best Songs You Should Be Listening to Right Now
summary: WSJ.'s monthly roundup of new pop releases: Everything that's grabbing our attention, making us think or getting us dancing. Find this latest playlist and more on our Spotify page. Stevie Wonder announced this month that he was releasing two new songs, "Can't Put It in the Hands of Fate" and "Where Is Our Love Song," via his new record label, So What the Fuss Music, which is marketed and distributed by Republic Records/Universal Music Group. The latter track longs for hope and peace, featuring acclaimed Texan blues-rock guitarist Gary Clark Jr. and a soulful harmonica solo from Wonder himself. All of Wonder's record royalties from "Where Is Our Love Song" will be donated to the non-profit Feeding America.

title: U.S. Commandos Rescue American Held in Nigeria
summary: Philipe Nathan Walton was grabbed from his farm by group seeking a ransom earlier in the week. U.S military commandos rescued an American being held in Nigeria after he had been kidnapped from his home in neighboring Niger days earlier, the Pentagon said Saturday.

title: The Trump Referendum
summary: The public likes his policy results, but his chaotic governance may cost him a second term.. 'The case for Donald Trump is political disruption." So we wrote four years ago, and the Trump Presidency has certainly delivered that, for better and worse. His policies and breaks from convention have accomplished much that was needed. But his divisive governance and personal flaws have put him in danger of losing to a Democrat whose campaign theme is essentially that he isn't Donald Trump.

title: Lawyers Prepare for Court Battles in Pennsylvania, Michigan and Wisconsin
summary: The Republican and Democratic parties have poured legal resources into three swing states where litigation could slow the tally of millions of mail-in ballots. Democrats, Republicans and voting-rights groups are readying for postelection legal battles in Pennsylvania, Michigan and Wisconsin-closely contested states where the late tallying of absentee ballots could result in litigation.

title: Joe Rogan's Podcast Sparks Tensions Inside Spotify
summary: Employees at the audiostreaming company flag the content of its No. 1 show for review. Spotify Technology SA's $100 million bet on Joe Rogan has put the audiostreaming company in business with one of podcasting's most popular-and polarizing-voices. Amid controversy, executives are standing by that voice.

title: Sean Connery, the Original James Bond, Has Died at 90
summary: The Scottish actor went from obscurity to international fame as the original suave-but-steely secret agent James Bond. Sean Connery, the Scottish actor who was catapulted to superstar status after playing the suave-but-steely secret agent James Bond, has died. He was 90.

title: Some Brewers Hate Lockdowns More Than Others
summary: Further recovery for companies like Heineken and Budweiser-owner AB InBev will depend on where they sell. Three of the world's largest brewers had good news about the global beer market this past week. Further progress depends on bars and restaurants staying open, though, and things don't look positive in Europe.

summary: Resume Subscription. Millions of mail-in ballots haven't been received by election offices in critical battleground states, where recent slowdowns in mail deliveries risk some votes not arriving in time to count for the presidential election.

summary: Tough competition is likely as city invites firms to apply for pilot program expected to start in March. Electric-scooter companies from around the world are expected to compete for the chance to operate in New York City, one of the most sought-after micro-mobility markets.

summary: Resume Subscription. MUNCHIQUE, Colombia-The gunmen burst in without warning, tossing grenades and letting loose a burst of fire and that killed six young men in an abandoned house that served as a cockfighting ring.

summary: Which titles helped entrepreneurs and others in the startup field? Here's a guide.. There are a lot of books out there that promise to tell entrepreneurs what they need to know to start and run a business.

title: Democrats Target Long Island's Once Trump-Loving Suburbs
summary: Congressional Democratic candidates are trying to pull off wins in districts that Republicans captured in 2016. Republicans are trying to stave off attempts by Democrats to flip two congressional seats in the suburban enclaves of Long Island where President Trump successfully appealed to voters four years ago.

title: Mississippi Voters to Decide on New Flag Design
summary: If electorate rejects magnolia as replacement for Confederate emblem, it is back to the drawing board. Mississippi voters will decide Tuesday whether to adopt a new state flag, following the legislature's move this summer to retire the old state flag that bore a large Confederate battle emblem, the last state flag to do so.

title: Is Kamala Harris's Fashion Her Secret Weapon?
summary: The vice presidential candidate favors a sophisticated uniform honed during years as an attorney-with some pointedly casual touches including Converse Chuck Taylor sneakers. Off Brand is a thrice-monthly column that delves into trends in women's fashion and beauty.

title: Tanzanian President Wins in Widely Disputed Landslide
summary: John Magufuli gets 84% of the vote in election without EU or U.N. monitors; U.S. Embassy describes 'serious doubts'. KAMPALA. Uganda-Tanzanian President John Magufuli won a second term in a landslide, election officials said, following a chaotic vote slammed as fraudulent by human-rights groups and the opposition.

title: Abroad At Home: Temples of Singular Tastes
summary: Take a virtual tour of four richly idiosyncratic collectors' museums in Europe. Care to see a painting of Venice's Grand Canal by Canaletto, a 17th-century key to Windsor Castle's state apartments, a stained-glass image of Henry VIII's heraldic badge (c.1530), fourth-century B.C. Greek vases, models of the Bank of England (c. 1803), an elephant's tooth, a 13th-century B.C. alabaster Egyptian sarcophagus, and many more antiquities, paintings, rare books, architectural fragments, plaster and cork building models, and other curiosities-all in one small museum?

title: Commentary: Postelection U.S.-China Trade Relations May Not Take the Expected Path
summary: Assumptions that trans-Pacific tensions would ease if the White House changes hands are misguided. The Trump administration's aggressive stance toward China has compounded uncertainty on U.S.-China trade relations. In considering how the presidential elections may affect the flow of international trade, companies should avoid the accepted wisdom.

title: Mail Ballots, Voting Early: What You Need to Know
summary: Record numbers of Americans have voted early in the 2020 election, and more mail ballots are being cast even as some voting rules face legal uncertainty. Record numbers of Americans have voted early in the 2020 election, and more mail ballots are being cast even as voting rules in some states are facing legal uncertainty because of court decisions. Here's what you need to know about mail ballots and what election officials advise to ensure that your ballot counts.

title: Israel Peace Deal Shakes Sudan's Fragile Transition
summary: U.S.-brokered accord is deepening divisions within a coalition guiding Sudan since the ouster of strongman Omar al-Bashir. KAMPALA, Uganda-A U.S.-brokered peace deal with Israel has deepened rifts in Sudan's fragile transitional government, divisions that are set to delay the implementation of central elements of the agreement and could destabilize a nation still recovering from decades of internal conflict.

title: The Core Workout That Keeps an NFL Team Running
summary: Resume Subscription. It's hard not to marvel when you watch Chris Conley, a wide receiver on the Jacksonville Jaguars, extend his arms to make a tough catch and keep sprinting down the field. His secret? According to Cassie Ettel, the team's associate athletic trainer, it's a strong, stable core.

title: Stock-Trading Problems Push European Investors to Call for Data Changes
summary: Outages renew calls for Europe to follow U.S. on disseminating share prices across venues. Investors in Europe learned the hard way this month that key structural differences between some of the region's main stock exchanges and their U.S. counterparts put them at a costly disadvantage when it comes to trading stocks.

title: In Luxury Market, Being Amazon Is Still a Burden
summary: E-commerce giant's new Luxury Stores launched with Oscar de la Renta, but few big fashion houses have so far followed suit. Oscar de la Renta took the plunge. The fashion house this fall began selling a $2,000 black lace cocktail dress in an unlikely place: Amazon . com Inc. Few others have followed.

title: Covid-19 Is Worse in the Dakotas Than It Was in the Spring's Hot Spots
summary: Businesses are open and masks are a personal choice; virus will spread with or without government restrictions, officials say. The percentage of tests for Covid-19 coming back positive in South Dakota has soared to 46%. That's more than eight times the World Health Organization's recommended 5% threshold for businesses to be open.

title: The Trouble With Words We've Read but Not Heard
summary: Harper Lee's bookish childhood gave her a huge vocabulary, but like so many of us, she often stumbled over pronunciations. On Oct. 16, at a political rally in Macon, Ga., Sen. David Perdue invoked the name of his colleague, Sen. Kamala Harris. "Ka-ma-la, Ka-ma-la, Kamala-mala-mala," Mr. Perdue said, before finally giving up: "I don't know, whatever."

title: Want a Gorgeous Garden Fast? Here's What to Plant This Fall
summary: Whether you're an urban transplant new to gardening or just want instant gratification, autumn is ideal to get plants in the ground. Try these expert picks for fast-growing, pleasure-giving varieties.. A SLEW OF NEW suburbanites is confronting the reality that their Covid-propelled flight from the city is more than a summer fling. They're often confronting, too, the fact that their new, sparse gardens lack character. They want lushness fast. Fortunately, fall is a terrific time to plant.

title: How to Avoid the 5 Worst Bathroom Design Mistakes
summary: We asked architects and designers how to steer clear of torturously placed towel bars, unflattering lighting and-ugh-wall-to-wall carpet. Plus: The craziest gaffes our pros have ever seen.. WHAT DO designers fear in the bathroom more than a monster behind the shower curtain? For Allison Babcock, an interiors professional in Sag Harbor, N.Y., it's seashells that rudely protrude from shower walls. "I cannot stand built-in whimsical accents in bathrooms," she said. If you want a little idiosyncrasy, she advised, focus on easily swapped-out accessories.

title: A $433 Billion Wall Street Giant Has a Reputation Problem. It's Josh Harris's Job to Fix It.
summary: Apollo Global Management is known for its cutthroat culture and sharp-elbowed approach to deal making. A co-founder is trying to change that just as Apollo is thrust into an unwelcome spotlight.. Josh Harris, the co-founder of Apollo Global Management Inc., obsessively weighs the risks and implications of decisions he makes: whom to hire for a role at the private-equity giant, whether to move forward with an investment or which trades to make to fill out the roster of the Philadelphia 76ers, the NBA team he co-owns. Former employees describe him as a micromanager who is known to call people numerous times in a day to discuss a small investment and spend an entire meeting rehashing unresolved questions from his previous one. Even Mr. Harris's friends joke about sometimes getting multiple calls from him in a single day to discuss the same matter.

title: The Mentors Helping ClassPass Founder Payal Kadakia Find the Right Steps
summary: For sage counsel, Ms. Kadakia turns to a serial entrepreneur, a tech investor, a venture capitalist-and a dance teacher. 'My personal advisers have been tough on me.'. In Personal Board of Directors, top business leaders talk about the people they turn to for advice, and how those people have shaped their perspective and helped them succeed.
